column5: Just checking to see if there were and resorts in the manitoba area that the total trip cost would be around 1000 dollars? We always go to ontario but looking for soemthing different but still have a budget. I know manitoba is expensive compared to ontario but I was just checking. Thnaks for the help.

What are you looking at fishing for are you planning on making the drive up? I know a few resorts that are affordable with accomodations but you will have to make the drive. NMhttp://www.xtremesportfishing.com/forum
We fish for walleye!!!! we would be driving as well. Thanks for the info. We do our own cooking and shore lunch stuff.

Go to http://www.wekuskofallslodge.com some of the largest Walleye in Manitoba come out of this lake (Tramping)nice location boats to rent and guides, talk with Tony tell him I sent you :) you can also try Chris @ http://www.athapaplodge.com/n54/ these lakes have incredible fishing and great scenery. Good luck on your search. NM
Hello, I have a small cabin I rent out in the Selkirk area where the fall walleye fishing is excellent and we have great cat fishing as well. Want more info, call me at 204-482-3988.
